author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md). The following guidelines were not met:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with an uppercase letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, not all letters are uppercase.
- Name is not at least five characters long
- The following dependencies do not have a `[compat]` entry that is upper-bounded and only includes a finite number of breaking releases: Cxx, julia
- Package name similar to 12 existing packages.
<details>
<summary>Similar package names</summary>

1. Similar to WCS. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2. Normalized visual distance 1.66 is at or below cutoff of 2.50.
2. Similar to SCS. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2. Normalized visual distance 1.85 is at or below cutoff of 2.50.
3. Similar to NES. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
4. Similar to AES. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
5. Similar to Run. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
6. Similar to AWS. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
7. Similar to SOM. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
8. Similar to COBS. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
9. Similar to ECOS. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
10. Similar to CAOS. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
11. Similar to RHEOS. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
12. Similar to ECC. Normalized visual distance 2.38 is at or below cutoff of 2.50.
</details>

- I was not able to load the package (i.e. `import ROS` failed). See the CI logs for details.

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
I think the naming guidelines here require some human approval since the package is intended for usage inside the [ROS](https://www.ros.org/) ecosystem.
Besides the name, this package can't be loaded

Hey @giordano, thanks for taking a look into this. What do you mean can't be loaded? Are there any changes that I have to make? (compat tag has been added in the new minor version if that's the problem)

> I was not able to load the package (i.e. import ROS failed). See the CI logs for details.

The log shows
```
   Building Cxx → `/tmp/jl_N9QWwO/packages/Cxx/1RaOv/deps/build.log`
┌ Error: Error building `Cxx`: 
│ ERROR: LoadError: could not load library "libLLVM-9.0.1"
│ libLLVM-9.0.1.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
│ Stacktrace:
│  [1] dlopen(::String, ::UInt32; throw_error::Bool) at /buildworker/worker/package_linux64/build/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.5/Libdl/src/Libdl.jl:109
│  [2] dlopen at /buildworker/worker/package_linux64/build/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.5/Libdl/src/Libdl.jl:109 [inlined] (repeats 2 times)
│  [3] dlpath(::String) at /buildworker/worker/package_linux64/build/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.5/Libdl/src/Libdl.jl:232
│  [4] top-level scope at /tmp/jl_N9QWwO/packages/Cxx/1RaOv/deps/build.jl:23
│  [5] include(::String) at ./client.jl:457
│  [6] top-level scope at none:5
│ in expression starting at /tmp/jl_N9QWwO/packages/Cxx/1RaOv/deps/build.jl:23
│ writing path.jl file
│ Tuning for julia installation at /opt/hostedtoolcache/julia/1.5.1/x64/bin with sources possibly at /opt/hostedtoolcache/julia/1.5.1/
└ @ Pkg.Operations /buildworker/worker/package_linux64/build/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.5/Pkg/src/Operations.jl:949
```

But I see this is due to `Cxx.jl` not working in Julia v1.5

> (compat tag has been added in the new minor version if that's the problem)

We wont accept anyway a package without compat bounds, so those must be fixed in any case.  Don't create new versions, keep the same version and retrigger registration just as you did before, this pull request will be updated automatically
Thanks for the help. Is there any problem if I create a new one since I have pushed the minor versions a bit?
No, but this pull request should be closed then
Ok, I will prepare a new registration and close this one when ready. Thanks again!

body:
- Registering package: ROS
- Repository: https://github.com/gstavrinos/ROS.jl
- Created by: @gstavrinos

title: New package: ROS v0.1.0
